section.name: Prepare
section.p: Follow all steps documented on the Developing with Maven page. Don't continue with the instructions on this page before you have seen a running application.

subsection.name: Install the Mevenide2 Plugin
subsection.p: This section assumes that you're using Netbeans 5.5. In version 6.0 the plugin is available as a feature in the Netbeans Update Center.

ol.li: Select "Tools > Options" menu item, click the "Advanced Options" button
Right Click on "IDE Configuration > System > Autoupdate Types", select "new > General Update Center"
Enter "Mevenide2 Update Center" for the object name
Copy/paste the following URL in "Server URL" field : http://mevenide.codehaus.org/nbm_release2/NBM_AutoUpdate.xml
Select "Tools > Update Center" menu item and select "Mevenide2 Update Center"

section.name: Run / Debug
section.p: Projects that produce a WAR can be run inside the tomcat container that is included with Netbeans. If you want to run several projects concurrently, each should get a separate context path. You can e.g. run the frontend application and the repository inside the same container. This can be achieved as [project right-click] -> Properties -> Run

The netbeans memory limit may should be set to a reasonable size (say, 512Mb) to run the included tomcat container comfortably. This is specified by -J-Xmx512m in the netbeans_default_options parameter in etc/netbeans.conf, found under the netbeans installation.

Note: project dependencies are not automatically handled. I.e. if a source file changes, all projects that use the containing package must be rebuilt in the correct order. (maven itself has the same limitation)
